sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含"规则的，正常的，正规的"之意。
means: normal ： 指不超过某种限度、符合某种标准或常规。
ordinary ： 强调一般性和普通性，含不突出的意味。
regular ： 指已有模式、有规律或定期的。
natural ： 侧重某人或某物的行为符合其固有特性。
typical ： 指个体能体现出群体的特征。

word_mean: 于化学，表示(i)当量的：溶液所含有效物为每1000毫升中1克当量重量
(ii)正链的：直链碳氢化合物，其任一碳原子结合的碳原子均不多于2个者
(iii)中式：指酸与碱结合形成盐后，没有残留酸的氢和碱的羟基时的盐
正常：在细菌学中，指未免疫的或未经细菌学处理的

sentence.Network_en: Life has not yet returned to normal but we are getting there.
sentence.Network_cn: 生活还没有恢复正常，不过就快了。

sentence.Network_en: The device can discriminate between the cancerous and the normal cells.
sentence.Network_cn: 这台仪器可以辨别癌细胞和正常的细胞。

sentence.Network_en: This picture shows the view from a car using normal dipped lights.
sentence.Network_cn: 这幅图片显示的是从一辆使用正常近光灯的汽车上所看到的景色。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent. (in the sense 'right-angled'): from Latin normalis, from norma 'carpenter's square' (see norm). Current senses date from the early 19th cent

entry.def: Something that is normal is usual and ordinary, and is what people expect.

example.ex: He has occasional injections to maintain his good health but otherwise he lives a normal life...
example.tran: 他偶尔要注射药物保持身体健康，但除此之外他生活一切正常。

example.ex: The two countries resumed normal diplomatic relations...
example.tran: 两国恢复了正常的外交关系。

entry.tran: 身体健康的;精神正常的
entry.def: A normal person has no serious physical or mental health problems.

example.ex: Statistics indicate that depressed patients are more likely to become ill than are normal people...
example.tran: 统计显示抑郁症患者比正常人更容易生病。

means.word_mean: 1. something regarded as a normative example;

sentences.sentence: "the convention of not naming the main character"
"violence is the rule not the exception"

means.word_mean: 1. conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm; not abnormal;
3. being approximately average or within certain limits in e.g. intelligence and development;

sentences.sentence: "the most normal person I've ever met"

auth_sentence.content: In normal circumstances it should completely dominate the record.
auth_sentence.res_content: In normal circumstances it should completely dominate the record.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In normal circumstances it should completely dominate the record.

stems_affixes.word_buile: e出+norm规则,规范+ous……的→出了正常状态→巨大的,过分的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 正常的,普通的;正规的,标准的
stems_affixes.word_buile: norm规则,规范+al……的→adj.正常的,普通的;正规的,标准的
sub在下面+normal正常的→adj.低于正常的
trans越过+normal正常的→adj.超出常规的
abnormal反常的+ly……地→adv.反常地, 不规则地
normal标准的+ly……地→adv.标准地, 通常地
norm规则,规范→n.准则,规范,准则,平均数
e出+norm规则,规范+ity表名词→出了正常状态→不正常→极恶,暴行

Sentence.sentence: reduced his revenues to a quarter of normal years
It ensures the normal functioning of an airplane.
When we are busy, people get angry and sharp, but that's normal.
On their way to creating a feminist paradise, the Swedes have unintentionally created a haven (避风港) for normal mortals.
A shattering loss of confidence inspires behavior that overwhelms the normal self-correcting mechanisms that usually prevent a recession from becoming deep and prolonged: a depression.
They are afraid the normal social order will be paralyzed

sentences.en: She braced herself to lead a normal life.
sentences.cn: 她振作起来去过正常生活。

sentences.en: He received four years of normal edication at college.
sentences.cn: 他在大学受了四年正规教育。

jushi.english: On this occasion we departed from our normal practice of holding the meetings in public.
jushi.chinese: 这一次我们一反常规不举行公开会议。

jushi.english: There is nothing to worry about.This is a perfectly normal baby.
jushi.chinese: 不用担心; 这是一个完全正常的孩子。

jushi.english: The normal temperature of the human body is 37C.
jushi.chinese: 人的正常体温是摄氏37度。
